problems.title: Clogged with Pet Hair / Low Suction
problems.description: Machine leaves clumps of wet hair on the floor.
possible_causes: Pet hair strainer in dirty tank is full
solution_steps: Empty the dirty tank and clean the red hair strainer.
Check the suction path at the foot.
Replace the filter if it is coated in mud/hair.

problems.title: Bad Smell While Cleaning
problems.description: The machine smells like wet dog.
solution_steps: Always remove the brush roll to dry after use.
Use the Pet Multi-Surface Formula with Febreze.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the suction on a CrossWave Pet Pro (2306)?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement filter or seal typically costs significantly less than a new $441 vacuum, and extending the life of your Bissell is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my CrossWave Pet Pro (2306) needs a new filter or seal?
faqs.answer: Common signs include strange noises and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the filter or seal on my CrossWave Pet Pro (2306) myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
